actions-list.actionItem: The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 8774 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Diaz-Balart moved that the committee rise.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Moore (AL) amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 210
On agreeing to the Jayapal amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 161

actions-list.actionItem: 308, 1 Present (Roll no. 323).
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8774 — "Making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
Pursuant to clause 1(c) of rule XIX, the Chair announced further proceedings on H.R. 8771 would be postponed.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 8771.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Wilson (SC) amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 257
On agreeing to the Waltz amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 209

actions-list.actionItem: The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8771 — "Making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 27.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 8774 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Calvert moved that the committee rise.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 140.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 140 printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 to prohibit the use of funds from being used to enforce subsection (b) of Section 1259 of the John S. McCain National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2019 (defunds a waiver that could otherwise allow the PRC to participate in Rim of the Pacific naval exercises).
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 139.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 139 printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 to prohibit the removal of companies from the Section 1260H List of Chinese Civil-Military Fusion companies.

At the conclusion of debate on the Moore (AL) amendment No. 129, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Case demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Moore (AL) amendment No. 129.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Moore (AL),  numbered 129 printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 to reduce funding for Defense-Wide RDTE by $4,910,000 to defund DOD climate-change research and increase funding by $4,910,000 for Army RDTE to fund enhancements for Unmanned Ground Vehicles.

At the conclusion of debate on the Jayapal amendment No. 72, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Jayapal demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Jayapal amendment No. 72.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Jayapal,  numbered 72 printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funds from being used to carry out the unfunded priorities list.
On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 58.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 58 printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 to prohibit classified telework and remote work for DoD employees.

At the conclusion of debate on the Greene (GA) amendment No. 57, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Greene (GA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Greene (GA) amendment No. 57.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Greene (GA),  numbered 57 printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funding for Ukraine.

At the conclusion of debate on the Greene (GA) amendment No. 56, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Greene (GA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Greene (GA) amendment No. 56.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Greene (GA),  numbered 56 printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 to require the salary of Lloyd Austin, Secretary of Defense, to be reduced to $1.
On agreeing to the Calvert amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the Calvert amendment en bloc No. 5.

Amendments en bloc  offered by Mr. Calvert,  comprised of the following amendments printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 as en bloc No. 5: Nos. 8, 15, 47, 63, 84, 85, 96, 113, 115, 116, 126, 127, 128, 130, 147, and 167.
On agreeing to the Calvert amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the Calvert amendment en bloc No. 4.

Amendments en bloc  offered by Mr. Calvert,  comprised of the following amendments printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 as en bloc No. 4: Nos. 9, 11, 13, 19, 20, 32, 33, 36, 38, 39, 40, 46, 50, 52, 53, 55, 61, 62, 64, 66, 68, 73, 79, 87, 92, 94, 103, 105, 107, 108, 109, 111, 121, 136, 165, 170, 176, 181, 191, and 192.
On agreeing to the Calvert amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the Calvert amendment en bloc No. 3.

Amendments en bloc  offered by Mr. Calvert,  comprised of the following amendments printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 as en bloc No. 3: Nos. 1, 4, 5, 12, 16, 17, 21, 22, 24, 35, 37, 41, 49, 51, 65, 69, 70, 74, 78, 83, 97, 106, 112, 114, 123, 137, 138, 148, 150, 152, 154, 166, 168, 172, 173, 174, 175, 177, 178, 179, and 193.
On agreeing to the Calvert amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the Calvert amendment en bloc No. 2.

Amendments en bloc  offered by Mr. Calvert,  comprised of the following amendments printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 as en bloc No. 2: Nos. 2, 7, 10, 23, 26, 27, 30, 45, 48, 54, 60, 67, 77, 81, 82, 86, 90, 91, 100, 101, 110, 118, 120, 122, 132, 135, 142, 145, 151, 153, 156, 157, 158, 159, 169, 180, 183, 187, 188, and 190.
On agreeing to the Calvert amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the Calvert amendment en bloc No. 1.

Amendments en bloc  offered by Mr. Calvert,  comprised of the following amendments printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 as en bloc No. 1: Nos. 3, 6, 14, 18, 28, 31, 34, 42, 43, 44, 59, 75, 76, 80, 88, 89, 93, 95, 98, 99, 102, 104, 117, 119, 124, 125, 131, 134, 141, 143, 144, 146, 149, 155, 160, 161, 162, 182, 184, 185, 186, and 189.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 8774.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Kelly Armstrong to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 1316 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8774, H.R. 8771 and H.R. 8752. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8774, H.R. 8771, and H.R. 8752, all under a structured rule. The resolution provides for one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit for each bill.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1316. H.R. 8774 — "Making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 8771 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Diaz-Balart moved that the committee rise.

At the conclusion of debate on the Wilson (SC) amendment No. 75, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Wilson (SC) demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Wilson (SC) amendment No. 75.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Wilson (SC),  numbered 75 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to clarify the funding prohibition of taxpayer dollars going to the Assad regime in the bill encompasses taxpayer dollars that are provided both directly and indirectly to the regime.

At the conclusion of debate on the Waltz amendment No. 72, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Waltz amendment No. 72.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Waltz,  numbered 72 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funds from this Act from being used to support the Gaza pier.

At the conclusion of debate on the Tiffany amendment No. 68, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tiffany amendment No. 68.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Tiffany,  numbered 68 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funds from being used to pay any United States contribution to the United Nations or any affiliated agency of the United Nations.
On agreeing to the Tiffany amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tiffany amendment No. 67.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Tiffany,  numbered 67 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 Prohibits funds from this Act from being used to enforce arbitrary restrictions on executive branch officials regarding travel to Taiwan and normal communication with Taiwanese officials imposed by the State Department through the "Memorandum for All Department and Agency Executive Secretaries" entitled "Revised Guidelines on Interaction with Taiwan" dated June 29, 2021.

At the conclusion of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 64, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Tenney demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 64.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Tenney,  numbered 64 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit federal funds to pay the salary of, reinstate, or reemploy Robert Malley.

At the conclusion of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 63, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 63.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Tenney,  numbered 63 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funding for Executive Order 14019, relating to Promoting Access to Voting.
On agreeing to the Steube amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Steube amendment No. 62.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Steube,  numbered 62 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funds from being delivered to the government of Iraq.

actions-list.actionItem: At the conclusion of debate on the Steube amendment No. 61, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Issa demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Steube amendment No. 61.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Steube,  numbered 61 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funds from being provided to the Lebanese Armed Forces.

At the conclusion of debate on the Spartz amendment No. 59, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Meng demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Spartz amendment No. 59.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Spartz,  numbered 59 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funding for the United Nations unless specifically authorized by Congress.
On agreeing to the Ramirez amendment; Failed by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ramirez amendment No. 57.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Ramirez,  numbered 57 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to strike paragraph prohibiting support of Migration Management.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 54, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Diaz-Balart demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 54.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 54 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to strike International Disaster Assistance funding.

At the conclusion of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 50, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Lee (CA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 50.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 50 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit the use of funds from being used to administer or enforce National Security Memorandum 20 (National Security Memorandum on Safeguards and Accountability With Respect to Transferred Defense Articles and Defense Services).
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 49.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 49 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit the use of funds from being made available to pay the salary and expenses of Antony Blinken.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 48.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 48 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit the use of funds to delist the People's Republic of China from the "Majors List".
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8771 — "Making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Thompson of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mary E. Miller to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
